These transformations are applied to h(t) to evaluate their influences and potentially infer properties of h(t) from their transformations. The function \( h(t) = e^{-kt} \) for \( k > 0 \).

Given the Laplace Transform \( \\mathcal{L}\\{h(t)\\} \), can we uniquely determine the constant k in the function h(t)?
Explanation: From the Laplace transform \( \\mathcal{L}\\{h(t)\\} = \\frac{1}{s+k} \), the pole of this transform directly reveals the value of k, enabling us to infer the value of the decay constant k in the exponential function h(t) uniquely.
